required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Replacing Canes With an Elasticated Orthosis in Chronic Stroke Patients: The Influence on Gait and Balance. A Series of N-of-1 Trials
clinical_study.official_title: Replacing Canes With an Elasticated Orthotic-garment in Chronic Stroke Patients: The Influence on Gait and Balance. A Series of N-of-1 Trials

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to investigate the effect of an elasticated orthotic garment "Thera Togs" on walking ability and balance in currently cane using chronic stroke subjects (minimum 6 months post stroke) using a series of N-of-1 Trials.

detailed_description.textblock:
Aim: To investigate the effect of replacing canes with an elasticated orthotic-garment on gait and balance in chronic stroke subjects.
Design Experimental, multiple baseline N-of-1 series with an ABC design with randomised period duration.
Participants Four cane using chronic stroke subjects. Interventions Phase A (9-12 weeks) usual cane-walking to establish baseline values; Phase B (9-19 weeks) intervention: orthotic-garment worn throughout the day with maximal cane reduction; Phase C (9-10 weeks) individually determined follow-up: either no walking-aid, orthotic-garment or cane.
Weekly measurement of Outcome Measures for gait and balance function

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Functional Gait Assessment from baseline to post-Intervention (up to 28 weeks)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Post intervention up to 28 weeks (on average 21.5 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Change of gait function between phases A (baseline) and Phase B (Intervention)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Trunk-sway from baseline to post-Intervention (up to 28 weeks)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post intervention up to 28 weeks (on average 21.5 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of trunk-sway at body center-of-mass during walking measured as Total-Angle-Area(TAA°) in frontal and sagittal-planes measured with a gyroscope "Sway Star" between phases A (baseline) and Phase B (Intervention)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Phase A cane walking (assistive walking-device a cane)
arm_group.description: 9-12 weeks usual cane-walking to establish baseline values. Patients walk with their usual assistive-walking device - a cane.
9-19 weeks : assistive walking-device which is an elasticated orthotic-garment worn throughout the day (product name TheraTogs). Cane use maximally reduced during his period.
9-10 weeks individually determined follow-up: subjects determine whether they walk independently (without assistive device) or with the elasticated orthotic-garment (TheraTogs) or with a cane.

intervention.arm_group_label: Phase A cane walking (assistive walking-device a cane)

intervention.description: Assistive walking device -elasticated worn orthotic garment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic stroke (> six months since last stroke)
- Independent cane walkers. Subjects usually use canes to walk inside (this could be intermittent changing from cane to holding furniture etc.) and always when outside
- A Mini Mental Score of 22 or above.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients at risk of falling identified as a Berg Balance Score ≤42/56
